style.name: American-Style Black Ale
style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. Fruity, floral and herbal character from hops of all origins may contribute character. The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Alpine Beer Company
breweries.description:
Alpine Beer Company opened its doors in the fall of 2002. Years before, an interest in craft brewing developed into an actual goal for the future. There were years of home brew competitions, brew science classes, and extended beer runs thinly disguised as vacations. 
The brewery went through an expansion starting in late 2008 and became operational in mid 2009. Four double sized fermentors were installed in an old garage behind the current brewery. A cold box was erected adjacent to the garage and a bottling machine with a nice labeler are housed there too. There is a small barrel shed on the shady, north side of the garage.

data.name: Unda Cova Brudda
data.description:
Imperial Rye India Black Ale. 
Balanced rye, roasty malts, and hops bitterness and flavor make this one a great evening sipper, the high ABV is hidden in the symphony of flavor.
data.foodPairings: Deep chocolate dessert. Robust sausage or meat dishes. Stinky cheese.

available.name: Year Round

breweries.name: ZümBier
breweries.description:
ZümBier translates to destination beer. We promote the beer experience. We brew 'to style' beers from Germany and innovation beer that truely wonderful.  The best of both the old and new worlds. Craft beer today is more than an adult beverage, It's an experience! 
We say 'life is a great adventure - drink it!'

breweries.name: McKenzie Brewing Company
breweries.description:
All of our beers are brewed in very small batches so they are always fresh and at their peak. Our brewers consistently bring home awards from the Great American Beer Festival, 24 medals so far. Our award-winning beers are brewed at all three locations, where our brewers strive to push the creative envelope.  Our beer selection is both consistent, with four flagship brands, and fresh with new offerings of seasonal and dark beers.

Unfortunately we can not go under the Steelhead name due to Trademark issues so we will be McKenzie Brewing Company.

style.name: American-Style Black Ale
style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Bell's Brewery, Inc.
breweries.description: Bell's Brewery, Inc. began in 1985 with a quest for better beer and a 15 gallon soup kettle. Since then, we've grown into a regional craft brewery that employs more than 200 people over an 20 state area, in addition to Puerto Rico and Washington DC. The dedication to brewing flavorful, unfiltered, quality craft beers that started in 1985 is still with us today. We currently brew over 20 beers for distribution as well as many other small batch beers that are served at our pub in Kalamazoo, the Eccentric Cafe. Our ongoing goal is to brew thoughtfully, creatively and artistically. We strive to bring an authentic and pleasant experience to all of our customers through our unique ales and beers.

breweries.name: Stillwater Artisanal Ales
breweries.description:
"A sincere artist is not one who makes a faithful attempt to put on to canvas what is in front of him, but one who tries to create something which is, in itself, a living thing." -Sir William Dobell

The goal of Stillwater Artisanal is just that, living art. Although packaged within a medium often overlooked for its artistic merits, our desire is to offer something new and intriguing. We present more than just a fine crafted beverage, rather an occasion that evokes an emotion and inspires contemplation. For art is not a sum of actions but rather an approach to life. We draw our inspiration from the world around us, whether that be a season, location, or even humanity itself. Our intent is to encapsulate this muse exhibiting an artistic rendition to the best of our abilities.

data.name: Velvet Revolver
data.description: Velvet Revolution is our original black lager, a delicious light bodied, slightly sweet larger. The body is smooth, the aroma malty and slightly fruity, with hints of chocolate in the finish.

breweries.name: Bay State Brewing
breweries.description: Three guys with over 70 years of brewing knowledge getting together to make Beer better. Chip, Conor and Shawn are gearing up to start full production of Bay State Beer Co. We currently are brewing small runs in a Massachusetts basement brewery in Sturleicesterville, MA and plan to have product available in keg and 6 pk this coming April. We will keep you updated as we go! Great Beer should be interesting, inviting and refreshing - both distinctive and drinkable. Our mission is to make Great Beer!

style.name: American-Style Black Ale

breweries.name: Brothers Craft Brewing
breweries.description:
Harrisonburg, VA is and always has been our home, so where better to open a brewery than in our own backyard? Well, maybe our taproom/brewing facility isn’t literally in our backyard – in fact we renovated a soda bottling plant to suit all of our production needs – but with such a close-knit and supportive community, every inch of Virginia feels like home.

Brothers Craft Brewing (originally Three Brothers Brewing) was founded by the three Shifflett siblings, who used their collective experience to execute a singular vision: brew exciting, unique craft beers that emphasize and support our community.

It didn’t take long to realize that same community was our extended family. The three of us may be related by blood, but our staff, our customers, and our collaborators have all become brothers.

When thinking about the people we’ve surrounded ourselves with and making sure we had the ability to continue to grow, we made the bold decision to rebrand our business as Brothers Craft Brewing.

Despite the challenges associated with such a change, we feel that our new name truly represents our evolution as a business. Why limit our brotherhood to three when we’ve gained so much family already?

When we started this endeavor, we couldn’t have possibly imagined the growth we’ve been so fortunate to experience. Since beginning production in December of 2012, we’ve had the honor of taking home various awards, expanding our production facilities and distribution, but most importantly we’ve been able to share our passion for meticulously crafted, delicious beer with each of our fans.

So thank you all for everything you’ve done for us. Thank you for keeping our dream alive.

Cheers!

style.name: American-Style Black Ale

data.name: W'10 Pitch Black IPA
data.description: Our Brewmasters' Release - Pitch Black IPA is a Pacific Northwest twisted tribute to an IPA style of beer. It is almost a traditional IPA but it is instead brewed to the emerging style of Cascadian Dark. We add a modest amount of a specially made debittered black malt to give this IPA a very dark color but without the characteristic dark malt flavors. Pitch Black IPA is hopped generously in the brewhouse and then again later during the dry hopping process. Hopheads of the world will certainly enjoy this dark version of IPA, as will beer drinkers looking for something new and experimental to fill their pint glass.

breweries.name: Widmer Brothers Brewing
breweries.description:
Widmer Brothers Brewing is located in beautiful and brew-friendly Portland, OR. Our publicly-held brewery employs over 150 people who are as passionate about quality craft beer as Kurt & Rob themselves.

We opened the brewery in 1984, and built a new 40-barrel brewing system in our current Russell Street location in 1990. We've grown steadily ever since. In 1996, we completed installation of a state-of-the art 250-barrel brewhouse, bringing our capacity to 220,000 barrels per year. In 1996, for the first time in our brewery’s history we also installed a bottling line, capable of producing 500 bottles per minute. In 2008 we added six new 1500-barrel fermentation tanks that increased our capacity to 450,000 barrels per year, and added a new keg filling line capable of filling 300 kegs per hour.

data.name: Wandering Pelican
data.description:
The summer of 2013 introduced the city of Cleveland to a unique and rare visitor. A brown Pelican, usually found in Florida and other Gulf states, wandered north to vacation on Ohio's Lake Erie coast. Swapping saltwater fro fresh, feeding on shad instead of mullet, this welcome stranger made Lake Erie his home for several months and became an unlikely local celebrity. This dark ale honors our courageous friend who traveled off the beaten path to find his home. 

Wandering Pelican Black Ale is a hopped-up American Black Ale with a dark, roasted character balanced by a floral hop bitterness.

style.name: American-Style Black Ale
style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Cigar City Brewing
breweries.description: Cigar City Brewing was founded with two goals in mind. The first to make the world's best beer and the second to share with people near and far the fascinating culture and heritage of the Cigar City of Tampa. From its past as the world's largest cigar producer to its Latin roots and the many other diverse peoples that call it home, Tampa draws on many sources to develop its unique culture. At CCB we are fascinated by Tampa's history and suspect you will be too.

breweries.name: Great Lakes Brewing Company
breweries.description: In the 1870s, Cleveland had 30 breweries. By the early 1980s, the last one had shuttered its doors. So when brothers Patrick and Daniel Conway opened Great Lakes Brewing Company on September 6, 1988, it not only signaled a new era in Cleveland brewing, it was also the first microbrewery in the state of Ohio. And the idea of a craft brewery in Cleveland caught on fast, as curious patrons hurried in for a pint crafted in the styles of old and drawn from the taps of the beautiful Victorian era bar. The company's commitment to sustainable business practices greatly contributed to its early popularity and success. Before long, Great Lakes Brewing Company had become one of Cleveland's most popular destinations for both dining and a fun night out.

data.name: Wandering Second Black IPA
data.description: A cascadian dark ale, brewed with caramel, honey, black barley, and munich malts. A complex malt backbone gives way to an herbal, floral bitterness. Hopped continuously with millennium and cluster hops.

breweries.name: The Dayton Beer Company
breweries.description:
The Dayton Beer Company is a multiple Award Winning Brewery and was voted  Dayton’s Best Microbrewery in 2014.  Our Pilot Brewery and Taproom is located in Kettering, Ohio.  We are in the process of opening our Production Brewery and Bier Hall in Downtown Dayton.

We are proud to be the first true Microbrewery in the Dayton area in over 50 years. All of our beer is hand-crafted with no automation in small batches with our own unique recipes. This allows us to create beers tailored with our own vision and style.

The Dayton Beer Company remembers all those who came before us and treasure their legacy by naming our core brews after them. Be sure to look for us at your favorite watering holes and retailers. As always, we encourage everyone to stop by our brewery to enjoy the fruits of our labor and relax and have fun in our cozy tap-room.

data.name: WhiteWater Black Beer
data.description: Brewed with a purpose.  Brewed for a cause.  Brewed to generate discussion.  This Cascadian Dark Ale carries the burden of dual responsibility.  Exciting you and your taste buds is Responsibility One.   Exciting you about the future of the Cedar River, as seen and utilized in Cedar Falls, IA is Responsibility Two.  $1 from each sale goes to the Prairie Rapids Project. www.nicktaiber.com/prairie_rapids

breweries.name: SingleSpeed Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Our mission is to brew beers built for the venturesome beer drinker, those unafraid to stray from the beaten path of simple flavors established by breweries much larger in size but not in creative energy.

As our name implies, we will be brewing at a slower rate of production than any of these monstrous breweries-designing and creating our hand crafted ales at one relatively slow pace, our "single speed", allowing each to emerge as a small artisanal batch formulated from recipes that include fresh, local, seasonal and organic ingredients.

data.name: Widowmaker
data.description: Don’t let its looks deceive you. Clean and smooth, easy on the hops and easy on the palate; this light bodied ale has a surprising depth of malt flavors with pleasant hints of a smoky molasses.

breweries.name: Keweenaw Brewing Company
breweries.description: Keweenaw Brewing Company is the hops-induced vision of Dick Gray and Paul Boissevain. Dick, a Michigan Tech graduate was looking for a way to return to the Copper Country. Paul, meanwhile, was introduced to - and seduced by - the crystal clear waters of nearby Lake Superior, the beauty of the surrounding area, and the small-town charm of Houghton, Michigan. The two men, whose passion for beer runs as deep as Superior, are the driving force behind Keweenaw Brewing Company.

data.name: Wild Willow Black IPA
data.description: Wild, rambunctious and slightly bitter. This Black IPA contains Cascade, Nugget and dry hopped with Columbus. It's a dark beer but fun and loving until the end.

breweries.name: Lake Charlevoix Brewing Company
breweries.description:
The Lake Charlevoix Brewing Co is a craft brewery located on the beautiful shores of Round Lake in downtown Charlevoix, MI.
Founded in May of 2015, The Lake Charlevoix Brewing Company is the second venture of the Round Lake Group LLC. 
The 5 barrel PsychoBrew system provides the Brewery the flexibility to produce our flagship beers, as well as a myriad of seasonal and experimental brews. The brewers also believe in supporting Michigan craft breweries and it is not uncommon for the brewery to have collaboration beers with different breweries spanning the entire state. 
The menu aims to provide guests with a quick, easy, high quality dining experience. 
For the convenience of our guests, we also offer a fantastic wine and spirits selection.

data.name: Wildfire IPA
data.description:
This unique black India Pale Ale is a tribute to the firefighters and emergency service workers who help fight our Canadian wildfires each year.

Wildfire IPA is intensely dark and smooth. This black IPA has complex hops that rage through to the finish. Fierce Hop, Gentle Bite!

A portion of the proceeds from the sale of this beer go to the Canadian Fallen Firefighters Foundation.

The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. breweries.name: Cannery Brewing
breweries.description:
Located amidst the breathtaking scenery of Penticton, British Columbia, Canada, our micro-brewery produces individually crafted fine ales and lagers of unmistakable complexity and balance. This flavour is the result of wonderful combinations of premium quality malted grains and carefully chosen Pacific Northwest hops.

All of our beers are created with carefully selected and scrutinized ingredients. We use the finest hops and grains and only the finest yeast strains. Our brews are all natural. They contain no preservatives and are not pasteurized. You get a fresh, crisp taste every time.

data.name: Winter Solstice
data.description: Brewed on the day of the solstice, this brew is Black as the dead of winter with a taste as bright as the golden sun. Better than frost, the bite of Winter Solstice BIPA is strong enough to lift you out of the winter blues!

breweries.name: Toppling Goliath Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Toppling Goliath is a stealth brewery, flying fast, under the radar. This has been true since the day we quietly opened our first ½ barrel brewery and tap room on the west side of Decorah, IA in 2009. The batches were small but the taste was gigantic, and word spread like wildfire.

Today, our team brews at a larger production facility on the edge of town, regularly experimenting at the tap room to satisfy our craving for new and exciting creations. Numbers are not our game, making a lot of the same beer is just too boring, and life is just too short.

The history of Toppling Goliath lies in the dreams of tomorrow, not the pages of the past. The past is for those who rely on high volume and low value. The past is for those who duplicate rather than design. The past is for cowards. We are forward thinkers and cunning crafters, quietly building our revolution. “Big Beers Brewed in Small Batches.”

style.name: American-Style Black Ale

breweries.name: Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company
breweries.description:
Leinenkugel’s. The brand born in Wisconsin’s Northwoods 143 years ago, shares a powerful story of adventure, family and brewing heritage. A story of fifth generation craft brewers. And a portfolio of 11 distinctive, flavorful beers. No other brewer more passionately shares its family history or connects with its fans like Leinie’s. 

The Jacob Leinenkugel Brewing Company produced its first beer in 1867 for the thirsty lumberjacks inhabiting Wisconsin’s Northwoods. Based in Chippewa Falls, Wisconsin, the brand has continued in the rich European tradition of brewing crisp, refreshing, and delicious craft beers.

data.name: Witching Hour
data.description: A black rye IPA, made with midnight wheat malt & hopped with Citra & Amarillo!

breweries.name: BrickStone Restaurant & Brewery
breweries.description: BrickStone is not just known for their delicious cuisine, but also for their handcrafted brews made right onsite. Our food and our beer are all made with the freshest and finest ingredients.

data.name: Wookey Jack
data.description: Wookey Jack is our first foray into the dark outer world of black IPAs.  Rich dark malts and spicy rye careen into bold citrus laden hops creating a new dimension in IPA flavor.  This brew has been left unfiltered and unfined to retain all of its texture and character.  At 80 IBUs, Wookey Jack is gnarly on the outside yet complex and refined on the inside.

breweries.name: Firestone Walker Brewing Company
breweries.description: Founded in 1996 by Adam Firestone (aka the Bear) & David Walker (aka the Lion), Firestone Walker Brewing Company began as a small brewery with roots in wine country on California’s Central Coast. Now a regional brewery, our singular purpose remains – to craft ever better beer.  Passionately in pursuit of the perfect beer…and never satisfied.

breweries.name: MadTree Brewing Company
breweries.description:
MadTree Brewing Company was started by three self-proclaimed “maniac” homebrewers and aspiring entrepreneurs who believe strongly in the creation of beers that stand up to the best craft brews across the country.
Along with that vision they put their own “mad twists” on their creations. The MadTree approach is simple – create high quality beer, educate the consumer, run a responsible business, and support the local communities.
MadTree engages local artists and craftspeople for their marketing materials, can designs, tap handles and furniture. Many of these efforts have received local and national recognition.

HIGHLIGHTS
- The trio quit their corporate jobs in 2012/2013 and in January 2013 they brewed their first commercial batch.
- In April they opened their taproom and became the first modern craft brewery to can their beer in the state of Ohio.
- Draft Magazine rated PsycHOPathy IPA a 97/100, the second best score for an IPA reviewed by Draft Magazine.
- PsycHOPathy IPA was named as one of the “Six New Craft Can Designs That Belong in an Art Gallery” by craftcans.com

style.name: American-Style Black Ale
style.description: American-style Black Ales are very dark to black and perceived to have medium high to high hop bitterness, flavor and aroma with medium-high alcohol content, balanced with a medium body. Fruity, floral and herbal character from hops of all origins may contribute character. The style is further characterized by a balanced and moderate degree of caramel malt and dark roasted malt flavor and aroma. High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Ei8ht Ball Brewing
breweries.description:
Ei8ht Ball, named after the streets we got our
credit from, we are humble yet proud. Local but not
influenced. We might not move mountains, but we will
push the envelope. We will test theories and create
moments through our liquid in which tones and times
are our muse. We will brew and flow with poise and
confidence. We will rush for no one, yet hesitate for
nothing. We strive to please but make no apologies. No
billboards, neon lights and flashy text, it’s not our speed.
Make us part of your flight or enjoy us with a meal and
the mission is complete. For all of those in search of
something diverse, unique, improved and fresh, look
into, behind, under and around the Ei8ht Ball. What you
will find is what you never thought you were looking for.
This is Ei8ht Ball Brewing, the proof is the glass.

data.name: Zero Dark Thirty
data.description:
At Beer Army we don’t back down from adversity-we challenge it. We don’t subscribe to being told what we can and cannot do. 

Nothing is impossible. 

There is more to our recipes than just ingredients. Our beer is bred with passion, zeal and integrity. What you hold in your hands bears tribute to a story that you are now part of. 

Join the revolution and liberate your senses-if you are drinking this, you are in the Beer Army! 

Poto Cervesia

High astringency and high degree of burnt roast malt character should be absent.

breweries.name: Beer Army Combat Brewery
breweries.description: The Beer Army Combat Brewery is a micro brewery located in Trenton, North Carolina. The brewery opened on April 19th, 2013 in the small town of 287 people.  The brewery maintains a tap room called the "Bunker" where patrons can come sit and drink inside the brewery.  Head Brewer Jeff Brungard retired from the Marine Corps in late 2012.  Owner Dustin Canestorp is currently enlisted as a Major.

data.name: Zero Hour
data.description: Excitement is in the mystery. Zero Hour is a black ale, aggressively hopped and blacked out with Midnight Wheat. You may wonder what style of beer you’re drinking; well, turn off the lights and savor the experience. Drink it in the dark

available.name: Year Round
available.description: Available year round as a staple beer.

style.name: American-Style Black Ale

breweries.name: 612Brew
breweries.description: In the heart of the Northeast Minneapolis Arts and Brewery District, 612Brew calls Central and Broadway home. 612Brew produces small-batch beers to satisfy both the weekend beer drinker and the craft beer drinker with a discerning palate. Enjoy the local brewing culture while sipping a pint in our taproom, then look upon our mirror-polished tanks or sit in the courtyard amphitheater and rain garden. Come on, Minnesota. I'm Thirsty Already.
